page.title: 09THE BUTTERFLY CENTRE
page.content: The Butterfly Centre, called Silverley House is in Theobalds Park Road and opens daily to visitors.Between 100 and 200 people visit the Centre weekly.There are special rates for school parties and groups, including an educational video presentation.7 full-time and 9 part-time people are employed.All stages of breeding can be seen in the indoor tropical Butterfly Garden.Most of the butterflies come from the Far East or South America. Caterpillar eggs and larvae are sold to schools.Their smallest butterfly is the British small tortoiseshell, the largest, The Orchard Swallow Tail. Birds like the Chinese Painted Quail or the tropical finch can be seen amongst butterflies, tropical plants and flowers.There is also a gift shop at the Centre.
